message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Carbamazepine is known to block voltage-gated sodium channels and has a side effect of causing double vision. The abnormal liver function tests can also be a side effect of Carbamazepine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Voltage-gated sodium channel blockers are used to treat seizures, and Carbamazepine is one such drug. One of the common side effects of Carbamazepine is hyponatremia, which can explain the patient's low serum sodium levels. Double vision is also a common side effect of Carbamazepine. However, the elevated liver enzymes may indicate a separate issue, and further investigation may be needed.
